tool.name: CulvertCapacityPytTool

param.name: points_filepath
param.dialogReference:
Points feature class compliant with the NAACC schema.

Use the NAACC Table Ingest tool to generate this data from NAACC downloads.

param.name: raster_flowdir_filepath
param.dialogReference: Flow direction raster, derived from hydrologically corrected DEM

param.name: raster_flowlen_filepath
param.dialogReference: Flow length raster, derived from hydrologically corrected DEM

param.name: raster_slope_filepath
param.dialogReference: Slope raster, derived from hydrologically corrected DEM

param.name: raster_curvenumber_filepath
param.dialogReference: Curve Number raster, representing curve numbers calculated according the the TR-55 method

param.name: precip_src_config_filepath
param.dialogReference: A Culvert-Toolkit precipitation data source configuration JSON file. Create this file by running the NOAA Rainfall Raster Data Download tool.

param.name: output_points_filepath
param.dialogReference: Output feature class, which will include all submitted culverts (even those that aren't valid), with calculated capacity and peak-flow/runoff estimates as a field, per record.

tool.summary: Measure the capacity of culverts by calculating peak flow over a hydrologically corrected digital elevation model. Culvert location data must be NAACC schema-compliant.
tool.usage: Measure the capacity of culverts by calculating peak flow over a hydrologically corrected digital elevation model. Culvert location data must be NAACC schema-compliant.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Cornell Soil & Water Lab, GroundPoint Engineering, CivicMapper
